properties.areaDesc: Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 2:18PM PST until January 17 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
...Hazardous mountain travel expected late Wednesday into early
Friday...

.A winter storm is expected to bring moderate to heavy snow to the
mountains and upper foothills mid to late week. Mountain travel
during this time will be very difficult with reduced visibility,
chain controls, and possible road closures. Gusty winds may bring
periods of whiteout conditions. Plan ahead and continue to monitor
the forecast.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Travel will be very difficult to
impossible, including during the evening commute on Thursday.
Tree branches could fall as well. Total snow accumulations of 1
to 2 feet, with localized amounts up to 3 feet, are expected.

* WHERE...Motherlode and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada.

* WHEN...6 AM Thursday to 6 AM Friday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels may rise as high as 3500 feet
on Thursday. Be prepared for significant reductions in
visibility at times.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered
roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while
the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are
calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 6 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
